channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: As Spain Mourns Train Crash Victims, Investigators Focus on Track
item.description: Officials on Tuesday were struggling to identify bodies from the crash near the southern city of Córdoba, which killed at least 41 people.

item.title: Khosla-backed Formulary raises oversubscribed $4.6 million seed round for its AI-powered private fund manager software
item.description: As private markets explode, founder Alfia Ilicheva wants to automate the tedium of tracking data.

item.title: Netflix Revamps Its Warner Bros. Bid, Seeking to Thwart Paramount
item.description: Netflix will pay all cash for the $83 billion deal to acquire major parts of Warner Bros. Discovery, instead of a mix of cash and stock.

item.title: One Year in Trump’s America, and the Fed’s Big Moment at the Supreme Court
item.description: Plus, the struggle to finish a major Olympic arena.

item.title: Last year, AI hype wowed Davos. This year, leaders are obsessing over how to use the technology at scale
item.description: Also: All the news and watercooler chat from Fortune.

item.title: Trump 2.0: A Year of Unconstrained Power
item.description: A round-table discussion of President Trump’s first year back in office.

item.title: An A.I. Start-Up Says It Wants to Empower Workers, Not Replace Them
item.description: Founded by researchers from Anthropic, Google and xAI, the new company, Humans&, is already valued at $4.48 billion.

item.title: Trump Doubles Down on Greenland Threats in Flurry of Truth Social Posts
item.description: President Trump posted private messages from France’s president and repeated his desire to take over Greenland in an overnight social media storm.

item.title: Britain Approves Contentious Chinese Mega-Embassy in London
item.description: The government of Prime Minister Keir Starmer approved plans for a massive new Chinese Embassy near Tower Bridge, disappointing critics who fear it wi...

item.title: As Spain Mourns Train Crash Victims, Investigators Focus on Track
item.description: Officials on Tuesday were struggling to identify bodies from the crash near the southern city of Córdoba, which killed at least 41 people.

item.title: Gaza’s Board of Peace: What to Know
item.description: Numerous countries say they have been invited to join President Trump’s newly minted organization, which critics say could undermine the United Nation...

item.title: How the Train Crash in Spain Unfolded
item.description: Two trains collided on Sunday in southern Spain, killing at least 40 people. Here is what happened.

item.title: The curious case of the ICE pastor as Minnesota protesters disrupt church services and DOJ launches investigation
item.description: "To have someone serving as a pastor who oversees these ICE agents, is almost unfathomable to me,” said Nekima Levy Armstrong, a reverend herself.

item.title: NATO vs. ‘TACO’ trade: Dow futures tumble 400 points on Trump’s latest tariffs while Wall Street hopes for de-escalation at Davos
item.description: "As such, the more likely outcome, in our view, is that both sides recognize that a major escalation would be a lose-lose proposition, and that compro...

item.title: PwC’s global chairman says most leaders have forgotten ‘the basics’ as new research shows 56% are still getting ‘nothing’ out of AI adoption
item.description: PwC's Mohamed Kande talked to Fortune about the "tri-modal mandate" for leaders to execute, transform and build: "I've not seen that in 25 years."
